title: Shell of charge compared to sphere of charge

content.question: A solid sphere of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> distributed uniformly throughout its volume. The sphere and five labeled points are shown in the figure. Which of the following indicates which points would have values for the electric potential and electric field due to the sphere that are identical to the values of the electric potential and electric field if the sphere was a conducting shell of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Points <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only
All the points would have the same electric potential and electric field.

content.answer: Points <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only
